div.head: 8.9.1885 Dienstag
div.p: Started from Hamburg with aunt Lulu this morning at 8 by the the Freia. The voyage on the Elbe was very interesting and the crossing good afterwards. When we arrived we of course had to pass the Läster allee. We were then beset by people offering us lodgings. We at last found some in the „Princess Royal“. We then dined in the Princess Alexandra Restaurant and afterwards had ourselves drawn up to the Oberland by lift. We from there saw the sun go down and then walked to the end of the island along the cliffs. The island is strongly indented everywhere, and one need not be a geologist, to see that it is slowly crumbling away. The decay seems to have got hold of the officials here too. The solitary policeman and the coastguards looked quite forlorn amongst this german population. The only defence of the place are five diminutive cannons, ranged behind a battlement 1 foot hight, which looks as if it had sunk into the ground, awstruck by the dreadful weapons of defence planted on it. I had expected to find a fortress, a stronghold of England in the North Sea and I found nothing but a watering place, a second Margate, where the Hamburgers go for a trip. I firmly believe that in its present state one small man of war might take place in half an hour and hold it. By nature it is a second Gibraltar, and if well defended would be imprennable but now - it is not worth the purchase money England wants Germany to pay for it. The Caroline Question looks blacker. They say Alfonso is doomed, and then – war is inevitable.
